column4: I am trying to get grub to boot my xp drive, but it just says starting up ...... and never boots
do you get the XP loading screen?
nope
just goes to a black screen saying starting up......
I was just going to suggest a screenshot, luckily i stopped myself ;) Type all the text that it says, verbatim
do what?
Anything that it says beside "Staring up...." will help us determine what's actually going on
thats all it says on the screen nothing else comes up after i hit enter to load Windows XP from grub menu
Is it possible that your grub is pointing to the wrong partition for windows?
pretty sure its pointing to the right partition.
What's your menu.lst say for windows XP? The whole portion, pastebin it
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63778/
I knkow a lot of people that boot into windows need to remap the drives so that Windows is on hd0
Try adding this to your Windows section, just below the title:map (hd0)(hd1)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/63779/   like this?
I had a second line, add both
not getting what you mean
I had a line to map hd0 to hd1, and one to map hd1 to hd0
Scroll up and see my message ;)
ahh okay
thanks that maping fixed it,
how do i add a line so that my windows install will appear under a like like "Other operating systems"
